title: 3 Crypto Stocks to Watch in the 2023 Ethereum Rally - Yahoo Finance
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Three crypto stocks to watch in the 2023 Ethereum rally are Accenture, CME Group, and HIVE Digital Technologies. Ethereum's price has soared in 2023, up 54.9% year-to-date, trailing only Bitcoin's 76.4% increase. These stocks are exposed to the open-source, decentralized blockchain platform and could benefit from the "crypto spring" expected to follow cooling inflation and market speculation of Fed's monetary policy shift. Accenture provides Ethereum-based blockchain solutions to businesses, CME Group offers solutions to invest in cryptocurrencies, and HIVE is a cryptocurrency mining company that mines and sells digital currencies including Ethereum Classic. Their expected earnings growth rates for the current year are 8.2%, 11.5%, and 78.1%, respectively.

title: Ethereum (ETH) Price Analysis for July 26 - U.Today
summary: Ethereum (ETH) price is up 0.13% since yesterday, with buyers trying to keep rates in the green zone. On a local chart, ETH is testing the resistance level at $1,860.50, with a potential breakout to $1,870 if the bar closes near that area. However, on a bigger time frame, the price remains bearish as the rate has not bounced off far from the support level, with low buying volume. As a result, sideways trading between $1,850 and $1,870 is likely until the end of the week. Against Bitcoin (BTC), Ethereum is trading at $0.064, with a potential quicker test of the upper level of $0.06435 if it reaches the $0.064 mark and holds there.

title: Ethereum Generative Art Challenger Highlight Takes on Art Blocks - Decrypt
summary: Highlight, a new platform for generative art on Ethereum, is launching today with the goal of making the process of creating and buying digital art more accessible and open to all. Unlike existing platforms like Art Blocks, which have strict curatorial requirements and fees for artists, Highlight will be entirely free to use and list on by any member of the public. The platform will also provide tools to simplify the process of creating generative artworks, and will support scaling networks to enable cheaper transactions. The first project launching on Highlight is "Sum" by artist Duane King, which generates unique and colorful artwork based on the minter's Ethereum wallet address. The platform is partnering with established generative artists who will debut new collections on the site this summer, and has already received input from artists regarding what they would want out of a generative art platform.

title: Could the Fed Trigger a Deeper Retreat in Bitcoin & Ethereum? BTC/USD & ETH/USD Price Action - DailyFX
summary:
The Federal Reserve's (Fed) upcoming interest rate decision could potentially trigger a deeper retreat in Bitcoin and Ethereum, according to DailyFX. The Fed is expected to hike interest rates by 25 basis points, which could boost US Treasury yields and the US dollar, weighing on cryptocurrencies. The key levels to watch for Bitcoin and Ethereum are:

* Bitcoin: 31000 (resistance), 24750 (support)
* Ethereum: 1620 (support), 1815 (horizontal trendline)

The weekly charts suggest that Bitcoin is struggling to break past a key converged barrier at the April high, while Ethereum is holding above a crucial support level. However, near-term technical charts indicate that both cryptocurrencies may face temporary setbacks if the Fed delivers a hawkish tone at its meeting.

title: Lacoste's New Virtual Store Has Exclusive Perks for Ethereum NFT Holders - Decrypt
summary: Lacoste has opened a new virtual store offering exclusive benefits to holders of its UNDW3 NFT passes. The store combines a traditional retail experience with Web3 elements, including an underwater VIP space for holders. The exclusive collection includes digital twins of physical garments, each with its own AR feature. Holders can also participate in a scavenger hunt game with weekly prizes. Emperia, the retail technology developer, has worked with Lacoste on several projects, including a previous shoppable activation and a virtual experience for L'Occitane. Lacoste launched its Web3 loyalty program UNDW3 in 2022 and evolved it into a dynamic token and gated community platform. Holders can earn rewards by participating in interactive games and fashion design challenges.

title: Worldcoin Has 'Major Issues' and Will Take Years to Work, Vitalik Buterin Warns - Decrypt
summary: Vitalik Buterin warns that Worldcoin, a new digital passport project, has "major issues" and will take years to work due to privacy, accessibility, centralization, and security concerns. Buterin argues that the project's design could capture more data than intended, including a person's sex, ethnicity, and medical conditions, and that there may be limited accessibility due to the limited number of Orbs available. He also raises concerns about centralization and the potential for malicious manufacturers to create fake identities. Buterin suggests that Worldcoin may need to team up with other decentralized projects to address these issues and build a robust system.

title: Flashbots becomes unicorn after raising $60 million - crypto.news
summary: Flashbots, a Cayman Islands-based software provider, has raised $60 million in funding to support the development of its Ethereum blockchain transaction packaging software. The funding round valued the company at over $1 billion, with investment from Paradigm, a San Francisco-based firm. The company's latest technology, SUAVE, aims to reduce risks associated with "maximal extractable value" (MEV) by fostering transparency and decentralization in MEV-related opportunities. This funding comes after Flashbots faced public scrutiny in November when the Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) expanded its list of sanctioned addresses to include smart contracts, resulting in repercussions for numerous Ethereum network users. Critics will be watching to see if this funding helps maintain transparency and efficiency within the crypto space.

title: Once a Pioneer, Cosmos Blockchain Project Faces 'Existential' Crisis - CoinDesk
summary: Cosmos, a blockchain project once considered a pioneer, is facing an "existential" crisis due to political infighting and reputational baggage. dYdX, a decentralized exchange built on Cosmos, is shifting to a different technology but its CEO doesn't want the dYdX brand associated with Cosmos due to the drama. Despite this, the dYdX founder expressed admiration for Cosmos and its potential.

title: ERC-20 inventor discusses origins, new blockchains, BRC-20 and more - Cointelegraph
summary:
Fabian Vogeller, the inventor of ERC-20, has discussed his motivation for creating Lukso, a new blockchain focused on mainstream use cases, and his thoughts on the future of Bitcoin and token standards. Vogeller left the Ethereum Foundation in 2018 to develop Lukso after his wife had an idea for a blockchain for lifestyle and fashion. He wanted to create a blockchain that would be more accessible to internet users, rather than just token, finance, or DeFi users.

Vogeller proposed the ERC-20 standard in 2018 based on a concept from Vitalik Buterin, and it quickly became the industry gold standard for issuing tokens on the Ethereum blockchain. However, he felt that ERC-20 was never fully thought out, and he wanted to create his own blockchain to attract a new crowd and create a new ecosystem.

Vogeller believes that Lukso is similar to Ethereum, but it offers a new crowd and a new ecosystem that doesn't currently exist. He also believes that it's important to create new building

title: CME Group: Ethereum To Outperform Bitcoin After Halving? - Bitcoinist
summary: The CME Group has published a report suggesting that Ethereum may outperform Bitcoin after the upcoming 2024 halving event. The report, authored by CME Group's senior economist Erik Norland, notes that while Bitcoin has historically seen price surges after halving events, there is no guarantee that historical patterns will repeat. The report also highlights the potential impact of macroeconomic factors, such as central banks' monetary policies, on Bitcoin and Ethereum prices. Additionally, the report mentions other possible triggers of a Bitcoin bull run, including the ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine and unexpected events like the collapse of regional banks. However, the report acknowledges that these predictions and factors could be wrong, considering the level of market maturation over the last four years.

title: Lacoste embraces the future with Ethereum NFT-exclusive virtual store - Cryptopolitan
summary: Lacoste has launched a virtual store on its e-commerce platform, offering an immersive shopping experience with an exclusive area for Ethereum NFT holders. The virtual store features a boutique, an outdoor pool area, and a scavenger hunt game with weekly prizes. This initiative represents Lacoste's progressive approach to e-commerce and customer engagement, and could inspire other brands to explore similar strategies. Emperia, the retail technology developer, collaborated with Lacoste on this project. The launch of Lacoste's virtual store marks a significant milestone in the integration of blockchain technology and NFTs into traditional retail.

title: Ethereum (ETH) Price Prediction Following SEC's Exemption of ETH as a Security; Time to Buy Uwerx (WERX) and ... - Blockzeit
summary: Ethereum (ETH) has been declared a non-security by the SEC, which has helped to stabilize the market. Despite a 3% drop in the past 24 hours, ETH is still trading around $1,854 with a positive price prediction. Uwerx, a new freelancing platform, is currently in its presale stage and has raised over $1 million. The platform offers a number of features and perks, including a minimal transaction fee of 1%, and has a presale bonus of 15%. The Uwerx team has also locked their tokens for 9 months and will lock the liquidity for 25 years after the presale ends. The platform is set to launch in Q3 2023 and has a price projection of reaching $0.76 by Q3-Q4 2023 and $1.99 by Q1-Q2 2024.
